summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York rallying colleagues for the opening of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial. It frames the trial as a pursuit of justice for historic sex crimes and announces logistical details for the court proceedings.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The central defendant in the criminal trial for sexually exploiting underage girls.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the email, a prosecutor from the Southern District of New York encouraging colleagues to attend the trial opening.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Opening
events.description: The scheduled start of the criminal trial against Ghislaine Maxwell, beginning with peremptory challenges, preliminary instructions, and opening statements.

locations: Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The prosecutor asserts the Southern District of New York's willingness to prosecute historic sex crimes, contrasting it with an implied reluctance elsewhere (specifically mentioned: Florida).
The core allegation is that Ghislaine Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable children.
The trial involves multiple 'brave women' taking the witness stand to testify.
The email provides specific logistical details for the trial's opening day, including multiple overflow courtrooms and an office viewing room.
The communication serves as a motivational rallying cry to colleagues, emphasizing faith in truth and justice.
